text:
Hey team! I've got an app that we send a form submission through the forms API whenever someone fills out a free trial in the app. This has worked, but now we're starting to get duplicate companies from other HubSpot workflows.

My thought was to use the new forms beta that allows company properties in forms so I can still make that same API call and have the form create the company.

1. Is this possible? (it doesn't seem to be, or the docs are out of date)
2. Am I just better off making a separate call to create the company and associating it with the contact getting created off the form submission?
SOLVED! turns out you can use `objectTypeID` in the forms API
Hi everyone, is it possible to search the contact object and return custom field data?
you can add a comma delimited list of properties to the query that you want returned
that can inlcude your custom properties - if that;s what you mean by fields <@U02MS5K4DLM>
<@U02JU710E73> thanks, I’ll give that a try
This is shown under the search endpoint on this page <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/contacts>

I sometimes receive a 409 conflict response when creating Contacts with the API and I'm not sure why?
My logic goes like this.
I do a search to find a contact by email address (i also search the additional emails of contacts too)
If a contact is found, i make an update request
If a contact isn't found - i make a post request to create a new contact

<@U7SL518D6> so you confirm that people on ios are tracked by the hs tracking code.

That way I can register event on HubSpot side and then I just need to figure out a way to send that event to the facebook API.

Do I get this right?
<@U01D95STUS3> Yes it will most likely be custom events
Hi, everyone, is posible make data of the pipelines for share in the homepage of my website?
For example all bussines won of my pipelines
